content:
• Tuesday, May 8, 2012
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) says that CEO Dino Dina has announced plans to step aside and...

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) says that CEO Dino Dina has announced plans to step aside and bring on an executive with more commercial drug company experience. Additionally, the company also announces a secondary offering of an undisclosed number of shares. Shares -11.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $166.7M (+18% Y/Y)...

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $166.7M (+18% Y/Y) misses by $1.4M. Shares +10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) says its founder and chairman Robert Stiller and fellow director...

    Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) says its founder and chairman Robert Stiller and fellow director William Davis were forced to resign from the board today because of margin calls that required them to divest of millions of shares of their stock. GMCR calls these forced sales " disappointing" and "beyond the control of the company" and said it was in the best interest of shareholders for the two to "relinquish their leadership positions." Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 7 Comments
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): Q1 EPS of -$0.44 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $88.6M (+132.5%...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): Q1 EPS of -$0.44 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $88.6M (+132.5% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT) -1.9% AH after Wedbush starts coverage with an Outperform, but...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT) -1.9% AH after Wedbush starts coverage with an Outperform, but doesn't exactly give a ringing endorsement. While positive on Ubiquiti's long-term growth potential as it fleshes out its product line, the firm is worried about growing legal expenses and signs customers are "still experiencing delays in procuring products." Ubiquiti was hammered last week following its FQ3 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO) : Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $34.1M (+53% Y/Y). Shares +3.6%...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO) : Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $34.1M (+53% Y/Y). Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs (TLAB +2.7%) made new 52-week lows in early trading today, but ultimately bounced on...

    Tellabs (TLAB +2.7%) made new 52-week lows in early trading today, but ultimately bounced on news CFO Andrew Szafran bought 200K shares. Tellabs, which has been bleeding share in the optical networking market, fell two weeks ago after missing Q1 estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q1 EPS of -$0.15 in-line. Revenue of $10.2M (-73% Y/Y)...

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q1 EPS of -$0.15 in-line. Revenue of $10.2M (-73% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • FTR

    A day after selling off due to a weak Q1 report, Frontier Communications (FTR -9.7%) plunged...

    A day after selling off due to a weak Q1 report, Frontier Communications (FTR -9.7%) plunged again. Shares are now at multi-decade lows, as fears about the decay of the company's wireline voice base take their toll. Sean Williams points out Frontier shares now sport much lower multiples (and a much higher yield) than those of U.S. telco giants. Frontier is counting on the delivery of IP-based video services to help put an end to its revenue declines.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 11 Comments
  • MTSI

    M/A-COM Technology Solutions Holdings (NASDAQ:MTSI): FQ2 EPS of $0.28 in-line. Revenue of $77.5M...

    M/A-COM Technology Solutions Holdings (NASDAQ:MTSI): FQ2 EPS of $0.28 in-line. Revenue of $77.5M (+6.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.3M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR): Q1 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $65.4M (+40.4% Y/Y)...

    Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR): Q1 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $65.4M (+40.4% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • EVRI

    Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $151.1M (+12.4%...

    Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $151.1M (+12.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) announces a secondary offering of an...

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) announces a secondary offering of an unspecified share ammount. The proceeds will be used for its acquisition of privately-held Composite Engineering. Oak Investment Partners has indicated that it intends to invest $55M in the offering. All of the shares in the offering are to be sold by the company. B. Riley & Company is the sole book-running manager. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • COL

    BE Aerospace (BEAV) finished higher today after Sterne Agee came to its defense, saying the...

    BE Aerospace (BEAV) finished higher today after Sterne Agee came to its defense, saying the early morning weakness was just due to Wesco Aircraft's (WAIR -12.1%) poor FQ3 guidance. The firm believes WAIR's guidance is related to company-specific issues tied to OEM inventory at Defense and Business Jet companies, and that BEAV sells its fasteners into the global aftermarket channel and is buffered from such issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • NLY

    Annaly Capital (NYSE:NLY) announces a public offering of $750M of Convertible Senior Notes as...

    Annaly Capital (NYSE:NLY) announces a public offering of $750M of Convertible Senior Notes as well as an offering of Series C Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Stock. Shares -1.6% AH following a 1% rise during the regular session. (PR #1), (PR #2)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 9 Comments
  • STEC

    STEC has resumed trading after posting its Q1 report, which included ugly Q2 guidance. Shares...

    STEC has resumed trading after posting its Q1 report, which included ugly Q2 guidance. Shares are down 11.7% AH. FIO -1% in sympathy. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $86.2M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $6.5M....

    Demand Media (DMD): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02.. Revenue of $86.2M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $6.5M. Content & media revenue +4%, registrar revenue +17%. Company expects Q2 revenue of $89M-$91M and EPS of $0.07-$0.08, largely above consensus of $83.3M and $0.07. Expects 2012 revenue of $361M-$367M and EPS of $0.33-$0.35, above consensus of $340.6M and $0.30. DMD +24.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • NILE

    Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE): Q1 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $83.1M (+3.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE): Q1 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $83.1M (+3.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q1 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $83.7M (+36% Y/Y) misses...

    MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q1 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $83.7M (+36% Y/Y) misses by $0.6M. Items sold +38% Y/Y, registered users +5.6% Q/Q to 69.5M. Brazilian revenue growth, recently cited as a concern, fell to 29% from Q4's 39%. MELI -7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • STEC

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q1 EPS of -$0.17 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $50.4M (-46.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q1 EPS of -$0.17 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $50.4M (-46.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.5M. Gross margin of 36.4% down 510 bps Q/Q and 610 bps Y/Y. Citing long product qualification cycles, the company expects Q2 revenue of $40M-$42M and EPS of -$0.26 to -$0.28, well below consensus of $51.6M and -$0.13. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS): Q1 EPS of -$1.88 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.76. Revenue of...

    Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS): Q1 EPS of -$1.88 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.76. Revenue of $29.5M (-21% Y/Y). Shares -12.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 in-line. Revenue of $48.2M (+296% Y/Y) misses...

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 in-line. Revenue of $48.2M (+296% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • DNB

    Dun & Bradstreet (DNB -13.7%) is the S&P's second-worst performer after again missing Q1...

    Dun & Bradstreet (DNB -13.7%) is the S&P's second-worst performer after again missing Q1 earnings and revenue numbers, lowering its core revenue growth estimate to 0%-3%, vs. its February estimate of 3%-5%, and closing a China-based business that is under investigation. Q1 earnings rose 27% on sharply lower tax costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GNOM

    Complete Genomics (GNOM -16%) drops hard after missing on its Q1 late yesterday on...

    Complete Genomics (GNOM -16%) drops hard after missing on its Q1 late yesterday on wider-than-expected losses. Revenue was down 42% Y/Y, largely due to an unexpected revenue recognition deferral for 200 units previously sold into Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • EA

    Though Electronic Arts (EA -4.6%) has sold off following its FQ4 report, archrival Activision...

    Though Electronic Arts (EA -4.6%) has sold off following its FQ4 report, archrival Activision (ATVI +0.7%) is set to close the day higher. The likely reason: EA's 400K subscriber drop for Star Wars: The Old Republic bodes well for Activision's World of Warcraft. Though WoW has been shedding subscribers, it still had 10.2M as of Dec. 31. That's far more than The Old Republic's 1.3M as of March 31, and makes the franchise a cash cow. (previous) (more on EA)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • UNG

    Natural gas flies higher, moving to $2.43. Chatter is centered around DHS advising that gas...

    Natural gas flies higher, moving to $2.43. Chatter is centered around DHS advising that gas pipeline companies have been under cyberattack for several months. UNG +4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver (KWK -6.7%) shares swoon after the company reports a wider-than-expected Q1 loss and...

    Quicksilver (KWK -6.7%) shares swoon after the company reports a wider-than-expected Q1 loss and a drop in revenue due in part to lower average natural gas prices and lower natural gas volumes from the Barnett Shale due to reduction in well completions, natural production decline and reduced capex. S&P cuts its corporate credit rating to B from B+.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • TRQ

    Mongolian anti-corruption authorities visit the head office of Ivanhoe Mines' (IVN -4.7%) coal...

    Mongolian anti-corruption authorities visit the head office of Ivanhoe Mines' (IVN -4.7%) coal operations in the country to "formally request information," apparently part of the government's effort to limit foreign ownership of Mongolian strategic assets to 49%. IVN's largest project is in Mongolia, where it owns 66% of the Oyu Tolgoi copper and gold mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • MTRX

    Shares of Matrix Service Corp. (MTRX -13.46%) slip after its FQ3 earnings fell short on a per...

    Shares of Matrix Service Corp. (MTRX -13.46%) slip after its FQ3 earnings fell short on a per share basis late yesterday. Net profit fell 1.2%, despite a 34% jump in Y/Y revenue. the company attributes the shortfall to to increased spending and ongoing problems with its East Coast operations, including instability in local refinery operations, warmer than usual weather and the impact of low natural-gas prices. The company also cuts FY12 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -6.3%) sinks to a five-year low after Moody's lowers its outlook on...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -6.3%) sinks to a five-year low after Moody's lowers its outlook on the U.S. coal industry to negative and expects a "permanent" decline in some aspects of U.S. coal consumption. Other coal stocks are getting slaughtered too: ACI -7.7%, JRCC -8.6%, BTU -3.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 10 Comments
  • IPAS

    Mobile VPN service provider iPass (IPAS -7.1%) sells off after reporting Q1 revenue of $33.3M...

    Mobile VPN service provider iPass (IPAS -7.1%) sells off after reporting Q1 revenue of $33.3M (-9% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.02, and guiding for Q2 revenue of $31M-$34M. Though iPass reported a 90K Q/Q increase in monetized users for its Open Mobile Enterprise solution, total monetized users only rose by 10K, and Wi-Fi network users fell due to lower usage of iPass' legacy platform. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • NVE

    NV Energy (NVE +4.2%) hits a 52-week high after its well-received Q1 report and dividend...

    NVEnergy (NVE +4.2%) hits a 52-week high after its well-received Q1 report and dividend increase, which the company says demonstrates confidence that NVE "is entering a period of more stable earnings and sustained free cash flow." NVE predicts in-line 2012 EPS of $1.15-$1.25, and will target a dividend payout ratio in the range of 55%-65%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUNH

    Shares of Sun Healthcare Group (SUNH -16.9%) get slammed after its Q1 met EPS estimates but...

    Shares of Sun Healthcare Group (SUNH -16.9%) get slammed after its Q1 met EPS estimates but missed on revenue. Overall revenue fell slightly Y/Y/, due in large part to the CMS Final Rule for Medicare reimbursement that became effective late last year. CEO William Mathies also adds that the reimbursement changes are continuing to have "a significant year-over-year impact" on the company's operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • ISIL

    Intersil (ISIL +4.2%) has steadily moved higher today, getting a lift from positive analyst day...

    Intersil (ISIL +4.2%) has steadily moved higher today, getting a lift from positive analyst day commentary. The analog chipmaker says it's now targeting $200M in quarterly revenue, a gross margin of 57%, and an operating margin of 24% - all of those figures compare favorably with recent results. (presentation - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD -8.1%) lose ground in a swoon that was kicked off in AH trading last...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD -8.1%) lose ground in a swoon that was kicked off in AH trading last night before the retail slump began in earnest. One of the sellers today could be large stakeholder Robert Stiller, after he was tagged with a margin call on his slumping Green Mountain Coffee Roasters position earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +6.4%) rallies on a down day after reporting strong audience metrics for April....

    Pandora (P +6.4%) rallies on a down day after reporting strong audience metrics for April. Listener hours rose 87% Y/Y to 1.06B, compared with 88% in March and 99% in the January quarter. Active listeners rose 900K M/M to 51.9M, and Pandora's share of total U.S. radio listening hit 5.95%, up from 5.75% in March and 3.11% in the year-ago period. The company also says it now has over 150M registered users, all in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNC

    The confidence in controversial supplement DMAA expressed by execs at Vitamin Shoppe is helping...

    The confidence in controversial supplement DMAA expressed by execs at Vitamin Shoppe is helping to lift up shares of seller GNC Holdings (GNC +3.4%). GNC still has products with the supplement on store shelves, citing an independent toxicology lab report showing it's safe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • AVL

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -26.7%) takes a hit today, trading at its lowest level in nearly three...

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -26.7%) takes a hit today, trading at its lowest level in nearly three years after the company delays the production target date for its Nechalacho Rare Earth Element Project due to an incomplete feasibility study.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • VSI

    Shares of Vitamin Shoppe (VSI +9.1%) soar after the company beats on both lines of its Q1...

    Shares of Vitamin Shoppe (VSI +9.1%) soar after the company beats on both lines of its Q1 report. CEO Tony Truesdale says on a CC (webcast) that the recent FDA warning on DMAA won't have a material impact on earnings, as the company plans to keep products with the supplements on its shelves until the FDA acts.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • EPAM

    EPAM Systems (EPAM -9.7%) slumps following its Q1 report. Though results beat estimates and Q2...

    EPAM Systems (EPAM -9.7%) slumps following its Q1 report. Though results beat estimates and Q2 guidance is solid (revenue of $100M-$102M and EPS of $0.30-$0.32 vs. consensus of $99.7M and $0.30), the Eastern European outsourcing firm's in-line 2012 guidance (revenue of $411M-$418M vs. $415.7M) might be disappointing some following a raft of bullish commentary in the wake of the company's February IPO
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -5.2%) suspends plans to build its casino in Foxboro Massachusetts following...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -5.2%) suspends plans to build its casino in Foxboro Massachusetts following yesterday’s regional elections in which residents voted in anti-casino candidates.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE -3%) follows the tech sector lower after delivering its first earnings report...

    Demandware (DWRE -3%) follows the tech sector lower after delivering its first earnings report as a public company. Revenue of $16.1M (+39% Y/Y) beat consensus by $2.2M, fueled by a 46% increase in subscription revenue, and EPS of -$0.23 beat by $0.54. However, that isn't enough to please investors who have given the e-commerce software firm a price/sales multiple north of 12. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • FL

    Buckingham says the weakness in Foot Locker (FL -3.4%) makes for a good buying opportunity after...

    Buckingham says the weakness in Foot Locker (FL -3.4%) makes for a good buying opportunity after shares get swept up into the weakness today of retail companies that sell products in Europe. Analysts with Buckingham have a $39 price target on FL lined up - repping 35% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • CLMT

    Hydrocarbon producer Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT -8.6%) takes a hit after pricing a 6M unit...

    Hydrocarbon producer Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT -8.6%) takes a hit after pricing a 6M unit secondary at $25.5, just a slight 2% discount to yesterday's close. The company plans to use the proceeds to pay down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM +3.5%) reports Q1 revenue was $13.6M vs. $7.7M Y/Y; on a non-GAAP basis net loss...

    Solazyme (SZYM +3.5%) reports Q1 revenue was $13.6M vs. $7.7M Y/Y; on a non-GAAP basis net loss was $12.8M vs. a loss of $5.6M Y/Y. "We have a strong balance sheet with ~$219M in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, our partnerships continue to advance, and we are well positioned to continue commercializing our technology," CEO Tyler Painter says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • FWONA

    Liberty Media (LMCA +1.1%) may pursue a spinoff of its newly-upped stake in Sirius XM (SIRI...

    Liberty Media (LMCA +1.1%) may pursue a spinoff of its newly-upped stake in Sirius XM (SIRI -1.4%) if the FCC backs its latest request for control of the company, according to a report from the WSJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +18%) gets a pop after entering into secured arrangements with...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +18%) gets a pop after entering into secured arrangements with some of its creditors to restructure its debt load and head off recent criticisms of its financial position. The stock has been hit hard recently, after an earlier disclosure that it had been served with a creditor derivative action complaint alleging it was insolvent.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • BP

    BP (BP -2.8%) trades lower on the back of a Barclays ratings reduction to Underweight, seeing...

    BP (BP -2.8%) trades lower on the back of a Barclays ratings reduction to Underweight, seeing the stock as "dead money on the 12-month investment horizon." The firm notes the Justice Department and Gulf states are looking to put BP on trial this summer over the 2010 oil spill, which suggests that very little progress has been made toward an out-of-court settlement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -15.8%) plummets after reporting Q1 earnings below consensus. Howard Weil...

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -15.8%) plummets after reporting Q1 earnings below consensus. Howard Weil downgrades shares and lowers its price target to $8 from $10, saying the EPS miss was driven by a ~2% production shortfall that was only partly offset by a slightly greater oil cut, resulting in revenues ~3% below what the firm modeled.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • AUO

    LCD panel vendor AU Optronics (AUO -4.5%) underperforms after reporting April sales fell 3.4%...

    LCD panel vendor AU Optronics (AUO -4.5%) underperforms after reporting April sales fell 3.4% M/M and 8.5% Y/Y. Shipments of 10"+ panels fell 3.9% M/M, while shipments of sub-10" panels fell 17.4% - the latter is likely more evidence of weak orders from mobile device vendors other than Apple and Samsung. The report is arguably a modest negative for fellow panel vendor LG Display (NYSE:LPL), and for LCD glassmaker Corning (NYSE:GLW).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare (THC -3.4%) slips on an in-line Q1 report, as net earnings came in sub-par on...

    Tenet Healthcare (THC -3.4%) slips on an in-line Q1 report, as net earnings came in sub-par on an overall rise in operating costs. Profit for the quarter fell to $58M from $73M in the prior year period, as higher expenses offset a rise in emergency department visits at the company's hospitals, as well as an increase in surgeries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • LKM

    Chinese mobile security software firm NetQin Mobile (NQ -13.4%) dives after reporting in-line...

    Chinese mobile security software firm NetQin Mobile (NQ -13.4%) dives after reporting in-line EPS and issuing solid guidance. The company expects Q2 revenue of $17.5M-$17.8M and 2012 revenue of $73M-$75M, above Street estimates $16.6M and $71.9M. That's apparently not enough to satisfy investors whose hopes were lifted by the hiring of Samsung exec Omar Khan as co-CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Leerink Swann weighs in on Dendreon's (DNDN -21%) mixed Q1 results yesterday, downgrading the...

    Leerink Swann weighs in on Dendreon's (DNDN -21%) mixed Q1 results yesterday, downgrading the shares to Market Perform on the back of the report. The firm cites less-than-expected growth of Provenge and concerns over growing competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZLC

    The stocks of companies selling jewelry get taken down a few notches on concerns that luxury...

    The stocks of companies selling jewelry get taken down a few notches on concerns that luxury spending in the U.S. will decline after European demand falters and China's endless thirst for jewelry isn't necessarily viewed as a sure thing anymore. Decliners: ZLC -6.5%, SIG -5.2%, TIF -3.4%, NILE -10.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -7.1%) tumbles ahead of its Q1 report, partly thanks to a bearish note...

    Universal Display (PANL -7.1%) tumbles ahead of its Q1 report, partly thanks to a bearish note from Piper. The firm thinks the improving performance of Apple's retina displays and high-end LCDs in general is delaying adoption of PANL's OLED technology outside of Samsung. It also thinks OLED TV manufacturing processes remain immature, and other applications such as lighting will have a minimal near-term impact.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • MDCA

    MDC Partners (MDCA +2.4%) bucks a weak tape after Wells Fargo upgraded shares to Outperform this...

    MDC Partners (MDCA +2.4%) bucks a weak tape after Wells Fargo upgraded shares to Outperform this morning. Wells cites recent acquisitions by the company and expectations for "multi-year organic growth" as its margin progress accelerates into the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • UAA

    More panic sets in within the retail sector, as names viewed as high-growth winners start to get...

    More panic sets in within the retail sector, as names viewed as high-growth winners start to get taken to the woodshed on worries on global sales. Under Armour (UA -7.4%) and Lulemon (LULU -7.2%) top the list of momo favorites ripping apart at the seams.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • MM

    Underwriter coverage day isn't proving kind to Millennial Media (MM -13%), as a slew of neutral...

    Underwriter coverage day isn't proving kind to Millennial Media (MM -13%), as a slew of neutral ratings lead shares to make new post-IPO lows. Goldman, Stifel, and Morgan Stanley all provide a similar refrain: they like Millennial's position within the fast-growing, underpenetrated mobile ad market, but aren't fans of its high valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM

    Marathon Oil (MRO -1.6%) is downgraded to Outperform with a target price cut to $33 from $39 by...

    Electronic Arts (EA -7.7%) makes new 52-week lows after providing weak guidance to go with its FQ4 beat. Particularly weighing on the Street is a 400K Q/Q drop in subscribers for Star Wars: The Old Republic to 1.3M - quite discouraging for a game that only launched in December, and was very expensive for EA to develop. Paul Tassi, among those who cancelled, says the game is too repetitive and too much like World of Warcraft (NASDAQ:ATVI), and simply not worth paying $15/month for. (transcript)
